doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: early 19th century; alteration: mid 19th century; alteration: late 19th century

Ivy Creek?--Overseers House for Leigh Property?--Higginson had a school here--William Wirt Gilmer Home before 1836?--J T Woods Home 1875--Kellam Home before 1889--Johm O. Higginson Home 1889--J D Wilde Home 1940

early 19th century 2 Story Frame: 1 over 1, Brick Nogging, L-Posts, Pitsawn Marks, Mortise and Tenon Joinery, Pegged Joinery; mid 19th century Frame Hall-Parlor that became I-House: Paired Column Portico, 2 Bay, L-Plan, 5 Course American Bond, 7 Course American Bond in Cellar Center Wall, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Rectangular Banisters, Wood Shingles, Plain Siding, No Ridge Board, Transom with Sidelights, 6 Panel Doors, 4 Panel Doors, Blinds, 6/6, 6/9, 9/6, Blinds, Barred Cellar Windows; late 19th century 2 Story Frame Addition: Circular Saw Marks,Ridge Board, 6/9, 6/6, Blinds
